image.altText: Two men in black uniforms with their faces covered and guns at their hips

props.synopsis: Hamas has quickly re-established de facto control of much of Gaza since the recent ceasefire. But a spokesperson says the militant group does not want to govern Gaza into the future.

title.children: Hamas will disarm — but only if there is a Palestinian state, spokesperson says

image.altText: Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: If the Coalition is indeed the living corpse it so often resembles, Watt and his boss Anthony Albanese will have little choice but to sit down with the Greens, a party they often seem to loathe even more than the Liberals, and do a deal.

title.children: Will the Coalition allow Ley to do a deal in good faith with Labor?

image.altText: Dark clouds loom over the suburb of Dromana in Victoria

props.synopsis: A predicated wetter-than-normal season has failed to materialise, and much of NSW, Queensland and the NT are sweating through their hottest October on record.

title.children: Dry spring heading for a course correction as La Niña emerges

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: The unintended consequences of Donald Trump's tariffs may be the exact opposite of what was intended: closer links between ASEAN countries and China, and the creation of an even bigger manufacturing hub in south-east Asia.

title.children: Unintended consequences of Donald Trump's tariffs on display at Asian summit

image.altText: bridget cotter

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast house purchased for an OnlyFans creator by a small-town businessman is among 20 properties frozen by the Federal Court in a $61 million tax case.

title.children: OnlyFans 'sugar daddy' and wife embroiled in $61 million tax mischief

image.altText: A female soldier in the desert

props.synopsis: Thousands of women are expected to join a landmark class action, which was officially launched in the Federal Court today.

title.children: Joining the ADF was Bec's dream, but it quickly turned into a nightmare

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie sits in front of a wall that has 'National Press Club of Australia' written on it.

props.synopsis: The man tasked with reviewing Australia's environment laws back when the opposition leader was minister, says he is "bitterly disappointed" she is pushing back on the reforms.

title.children: Ley lashed for opposition to environmental reforms by key report author

image.altText: Thi Kim Tran in a grey jumper, smiling in a picture, holding a light brown bunny.

props.synopsis: The alleged murder of a woman who was stripped naked, bound and gagged before she was killed shows a wider trend that Sydney's "guns for hire" are willing to break gangland code, a senior NSW detective says.

title.children: 'Big, big trouble': Police warn kill crews not abiding by gangland code

image.altText: Donald Trump gesturing with both hands as he answers questions from reporters at the White House.

props.synopsis: The US president has used tariffs as leverage on many countries around the world.

title.children: Donald Trump ends Canada trade talks over TV ad

image.altText: Close up of girl's face with large bump on forehead.

props.synopsis: More than a year after her 21-month-old child was hit by an e-bike, a Newcastle mother is calling for change.

title.children: Mother calls for tougher laws after toddler run down by e-bike

image.altText: A grinning Barnaby Joyce holds a lump of coal in the House of Representatives

props.synopsis: Threatening to euthanase Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's dogs, repeatedly calling out "caaarp" in parliament, that notorious moment on a Canberra footpath, Barnaby Joyce's career has had plenty of colour and movement.

title.children: From Pistol and Boo to leaked texts, Joyce has always run his own race

image.altText: Australian currency

props.synopsis: From phishing to investment cons, scammers are staying "one step ahead" in their efforts to separate us from our savings. Older Australians are often targeted, but there are steps you can take to protect yourself, and those you care about.

title.children: Elizabeth clicked on an email link and lost her life savings

image.altText: A satellite image of the White House from above, with the East Wing demolished

props.synopsis: The demolition has sparked angry backlash from Democrats and raised questions about whether the Trump administration followed proper protocols.

title.children: Satellite images show the White House's East Wing has been demolished

image.altText: Two AFLW players in blue and black celebrate a win

props.synopsis: Indy Tahau breaks the AFLW home-and-away season goal-kicking record in Port's breakthrough seven-point defeat of Adelaide.

title.children: Power stun Crows as Tahau breaks AFLW goal-kicking record

image.altText: Pete Hegseth looking at the camera with a stern expression and furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: The frequency of the strikes has increased from one every few weeks in September to three in one week now.

title.children: US strikes 10th alleged drug-running boat in the Caribbean

image.altText: Mobile vision of two people descending down a crane to a street.

props.synopsis: Video shared widely on social media appears to show alleged Louvre jewellery thieves escaping on a crane near the Seine.

title.children: New video appears to show alleged Louvre thieves escaping in broad daylight

image.altText: A picture of Karima Hazim in a dark apron smiling against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Precision meal planning is not for every household and these family cooks say there are other ways to make mealtimes easier.

title.children: How these three families organise cooking to make weeknight dinners easier

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price and her husband walk into a building with serious expressions.

props.synopsis: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price testifies in her own Federal Court defamation trial in Darwin, following cross-examination from the head of the Central Land Council.

title.children: Senator stands by press release at centre of defamation trial

image.altText: A man in a suit outside of a court house.

props.synopsis: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell is being provided with access to Mein Kampf — a political manifesto written by Nazi Party leader Adolf Hitler — as he prepares for a contested court hearing.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell granted access to Adolf Hitler manifesto

image.altText: homemade chilli paste collage

props.synopsis: Queensland Health says three of the five people who presented to hospital with brodifacoum poisoning last week consumed two homemade dishes which later tested positive to the toxin.

title.children: Health authorities suspect homemade food linked to rat poisoning cluster

image.altText: Man holding phone horizontally while wearing body camera on a property that looks like a farm with mountain in the background

props.synopsis: Mount Buffalo National Park will open to everyone as Victoria Police's search for Dezi Freeman continues with the creation of a new taskforce.

title.children: Freeman search continues as Mount Buffalo fully reopens to public

image.altText: Chauncey Billups yells at a referee

props.synopsis: Seven years ago, the United States crossed a line that it once dared to never cross, leading to a string of arrests that threaten to tarnish sports in the country for generations to come.

title.children: US faces a reckoning after blurring line between gambling and sport

image.altText: Sea bird flies past the background landscape of Antarctic island.

props.synopsis: Suspected bird flu has reached Australia's sub-Antarctic Heard Island, with signs of the deadly H5 avian disease observed in elephant seals.

title.children: Deadly strain of bird flu suspected on remote Australian island

image.altText: Two wind towers, in front of a sunset on a mountain

props.synopsis: After three years of construction, one of the biggest wind farms in the country has been switched on. The large-scale project has not been without controversy.

title.children: $1 billion wind farm backed by Andrew 'Twiggy' Forrest opens

image.altText: Tributes laid on grass

props.synopsis: A woman has been charged with murder and arson after a house fire that took the lives of a woman and two young children in Gladstone.

title.children: Woman charged with murder, arson after house fire kills three

image.altText: a chinese passport and lanyard

props.synopsis: Police say they've been investigating reports about scammers impersonating Chinese police officers or authority figures.

title.children: Woman arrested over alleged Chinese police impersonation scam

image.altText: A black object on a dusty red dirt road.

props.synopsis: How closely were you following the news this week? Test yourself to find out!

title.children: News quiz: A jewel heist, an awkward Trump moment and an outback mystery

image.altText: A split image showing Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump, both in suits.

props.synopsis: The Russian president acknowledged that the move to sanction two oil companies would have "certain consequences", but would not significantly impact the country's economy.

title.children: 'Unfriendly' US oil sanctions will have little effect, Putin says

image.altText: Elise Hodder poses during a photo shoot, looking across the camera and seen from side profile.

props.synopsis: Drunk driver Connor Mathiasson returned a blood alcohol reading more than four times the legal limit and had traces of cocaine and cannabis in his system when he killed Elise Hodder.

title.children: Elise Hodder's parents say model's future 'ripped away' after fatal crash

image.altText: A video of an alleged stolen vehicle chasing a police car.

props.synopsis: Children as young as 10 have been arrested as stolen vehicles are driven recklessly at police cars.

title.children: Kimberley police warn juvenile crime 'won't be tolerated'

image.altText: Lib dog

props.synopsis: The Liberals have faced an existential crisis over climate and energy twice in recent memory. The damage must live in the memory of today's parliamentarians, who face the prospect of another episode.

title.children: Tough lesson for Libs in proverb about dogs and vomit, fools and folly

image.altText: .A young woman with fair skin and brown hair

props.synopsis: Despite one in four sufferers being under 65, experts say there is a common misconception that strokes only occur in older people. Mental well-being is key to recovery but is often more difficult for younger stroke survivors.

title.children: Elena was a fit and healthy 20-year-old — then she had a stroke

image.altText: Nick McKenzie wearing a blue suit and tie

props.synopsis: Victoria Police are investigating a burglary at the home of award-winning journalist Nick McKenzie.

title.children: Construction industry taskforce investigate burglary at journalist's home

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a beige and brown patterned shirt stands at a lectern, with four Pacific leaders behind him.

props.synopsis: Beijing reprimanded Pacific Island nation ambassadors for including Taiwan in the regional summit last month, but Australia and New Zealand have lent their support.

title.children: Australia backs Pacific Islands facing China heat over Taiwan

image.altText: A person holds a fishing rod. There is blue ocean in the background

props.synopsis: Catch limits for recreational fishers will be reduced amid 'severe decline' in fish species due to the algal bloom.

title.children: Recreational fishers say new restrictions are unfairly targeted
